item.title: Laura Jean add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "A children's story that can only be enjoyed by children is not a good children's story in the slightest." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Laura Jean add a quote by Henry Ward Beecherr
item.description: "Where is human nature so weak as in the bookstore?" -- Henry Ward Beecherr

item.title: Laura Jean add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "I cannot live without books." -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Laura Jean add a quote by Desiderius Erasmus Roterodamus
item.description: "When I have a little money, I buy books; and if I have any left, I buy food and clothes." -- Desiderius Erasmus Roterodamus

item.title: Laura Jean add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "She is too fond of books, and it has turned her brain." -- Louisa May Alcott

item.title: Laura Jean add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "No book is really worth reading at the age of ten which is not equally – and often far more – worth reading at the age of fifty and beyond." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Laura Jean add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description:
"And on the subject of burning books: I want to congratulate librarians, not famous for their physical strength or their powerful political connections or their great wealth, who, all over this country, have staunchly resisted anti-democratic bullies who have tried to remove certain books from their shelves, and have refused to reveal to thought police the names of persons who have checked out those titles.
So the America I loved still exists, if not in the White House or the Supreme Court or the Senate or the House of Representatives or the media. The America I love still exists at the front desks of our public libraries." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Laura Jean add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "No, my heart will not yet despair. Gandalf fell and has returned and is with us. We may stand, if only on one leg, or at least be left still upon our knees." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Laura Jean add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description:
"Farewell," they cried, "Wherever you fare till your eyries receive you at the journey's end!" That is the polite thing to say among eagles.
"May the wind under your wings bear you where the sun sails and the moon walks," answered Gandalf, who knew the correct reply." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Laura Jean add a quote by Stephanie Pearl-McPhee
item.description: "Achieving the state of SABLE is not, as many people who live with these knitters believe, a reason to stop buying yarn, but for the knitter it is an indication to write a will, bequeathing the stash to an appropriate heir." -- Stephanie Pearl-McPhee

item.title: Laura Jean add a quote by Stephanie Pearl-McPhee
item.description: "SABLE- A common knitting acronym that stands for Stash Acquisition Beyond Life Expectancy." -- Stephanie Pearl-McPhee

item.title: Laura Jean add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Unless someone like you cares a whole awful lot, Nothing is going to get better. It's not." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Laura Jean add a quote by Thomas Paine
item.description: "These are the times that try men's souls." -- Thomas Paine

item.title: Laura Jean add a quote by Gloria Naylor
item.description: "The music in his laughter had a way of rounding off the missing notes in her soul." -- Gloria Naylor

item.title: Laura Jean add a quote by Leonora Carrington
item.description: "We went down into the silent garden. Dawn is the time when nothing breathes, the hour of silence. Everything is transfixed, only the light moves." -- Leonora Carrington

item.title: Laura Jean add a quote by François Rabelais
item.description: "I go to seek a Great Perhaps." -- François Rabelais

item.title: Laura Jean add a quote by Beverly Cleary
item.description: "She was not a slowpoke grownup. She was a girl who could not wait. Life was so interesting she had to find out what happened next." -- Beverly Cleary

item.title: Laura Jean add a quote by Seamus Heaney
item.description: "If you have the words, there's always a chance that you'll find the way." -- Seamus Heaney

item.title: Laura Jean add a quote by Edward Gorey
item.description: "The helpful thought for which you look Is written somewhere in a book." -- Edward Gorey

item.title: Laura Jean add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description:
"Courage is an inner resolution to go forward despite obstacles; Cowardice is submissive surrender to circumstances. Courage breeds creativity; Cowardice represses fear and is mastered by it. Cowardice asks the question, is it safe? Expediency ask the question, is it politic? Vanity asks the question, is it popular?
But conscience ask the question, is it right? And there comes a time when we must take a position that is neither safe, nor politic, nor popular, but one must take it because it is right." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Laura Jean add a quote by John Muir
item.description: "The clearest way into the Universe is through a forest wilderness." -- John Muir

item.title: Laura Jean add a quote by Bobbie Ann Mason
item.description: "One day I was counting the cats and I absent-mindedly counted myself." -- Bobbie Ann Mason

item.title: Laura Jean add a quote by Jenny Joseph
item.description: "When I am an old woman I shall wear purple. With a red hat which doesn't go, and doesn't suit me." -- Jenny Joseph

item.title: Laura Jean add a quote by Edward Lear
item.description: "The Owl and the Pussy-cat went to sea In a beautiful pea green boat..." -- Edward Lear

item.title: Laura Jean add a quote by W.G. Sebald
item.description: "It is thanks to my evening reading alone that I am still more or less sane." -- W.G. Sebald

item.title: Laura Jean add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "Perhaps one did not want to be loved so much as to be understood." -- George Orwell

item.title: Laura Jean add a quote by Yasunari Kawabata
item.description: "As he caught his footing, his head fell back, and the Milky Way flowed down inside him with a roar." -- Yasunari Kawabata

item.title: Laura Jean add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Child" said the Voice, "I am telling you your story, not hers. I tell no one any story but his own." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Laura Jean add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "You can't depend on your eyes when your imagination is out of focus." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Laura Jean add a quote by Jerry Garcia
item.description: "What a long strange trip it's been." -- Jerry Garcia
